subject: Re: Using JUnit with Java Web Start
msgSnippet: ... I m a teacher, and want to create a test suite so that my students can check the correctness of their practical exercises, even if they re working at home
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Shane Mingins <shanemingins@y...> wrote:

> I guess I am still missing what it is you are trying
> to achieve with this approach. Are you trying to have
> the tests run everytime someone runs the app? Who are
> reffering to with the word "users"? Users of the app?
>
I'm a teacher, and want to create a test suite so that my students can
check the correctness of their practical exercises, even if they're
working at home or other remote location.

Reading the web start documentation a bit more carefully I've located
the general problem. Web deployed apps must be written with that in
mind, eg using getResource rather than trying to access resources (eg
images, text files) from the file system (and the local classpath
variable cannot be used either, which complicates matters for my
particular purpose). I think I'll just stay with local media rather
than a web-based solution.
